content: I thought I would start a new thread for this, as thoughts come up.
The admin bar, 'Menu Search' input field is missing a label.

You can see an explanation and sample solution listed here: https://blog.pope.tech/2020/02/28/missing-form-label-search/

Missing Form Label - Site Search example - Pope Tech Blog
Real world example on the Missing Form Label Error found on a site search form and possible solution.

This code specifically

<input placeholder="Menu search" autocomplete="off" autocorrect="off" autocapitalize="off" type="search" size="60" maxlength="128" class="form-search">
That should be an easy fix (either with label or with aria-label, didn't look at the code yet). Mind to open an issue for that?

Therefore the change should be to add an ID to the class. And create a seperate label field, which is hidden using CSS, but shown using a screen reader. Then if a device for some reason doesnt use area-label, it should still show

<label for="menuSearch" class="sr-only">Administration Bar Menu Search</label>
<input id="menuSearch" placeholder="Menu search" autocomplete="off" autocorrect="off" autocapitalize="off" type="search" size="60" maxlength="128" class="form-search">
Sure, I will give it a try :)

Thank you for the suggestion. Ive added it here: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4997
